pgTitle: List of American Civil War Medal of Honor recipients: A–F

rows.text: Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Planted the flag upon the parapet while the enemy still occupied the line; was the first of his regiment to enter the works.
Error: 1863 Jul 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of 16th North Carolina regiment (C.S.A.).
Error: 1864 Sep 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 May 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Jul 12 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 May 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Was one of a party that volunteered and attempted to run the enemy's batteries with a steam tug and 2 barges loaded with subsistence stores.
Error: 1863 Nov 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

As color bearer, led his regiment in the assault, and, though wounded, carried the flag forward to the enemy's works, where he was again wounded. In a brigade of 8 regiments this flag was the first planted on the parapet.
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Was one of a detachment of 20 picked artillerymen who voluntarily accompanied an infantry assaulting party, and who turned upon the enemy the guns captured in the assault.
Error: 1864 May 12 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Six color bearers of the regiment having been killed, he voluntarily took both flags of the regiment and carried them through the remainder of the battle.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Among the first to enter the enemy's works; although wounded.
Error: 1863 Nov 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Although suffering severely from wounds, he led his regiment, inciting the men to greater action by word and example until again severely wounded.

Error: 1864 Dec This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1865 Jan This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Barnum served on board the U.S.S. New Ironsides during action in several attacks on Fort Fisher, 24 and 25 December 1864; and on 13, 14, and 15 January 1865 and was commended for highly meritorious conduct during this period.
Error: 1865 Apr This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Hazardous service in marching through the enemy's country to bring relief to his command.

Error: 1863 May 26 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1863 Jun 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
While on a scout captured single-handed 2 desperate Confederate guerrilla officers who were together and well armed at the time.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party.
Gallantry in various actions during the rebellion.
Error: 1865 Jan 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Minnesota in action during the assault on Fort Fisher, 15 January 1865.
Error: 1862 October 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Jan 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Minnesota in action during the assault on Fort Fisher, 15 January 1865.

Error: 1863 Oct 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1863 Oct 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Being ordered to move his trains by a continuous day-and-night march, and without the usual military escort, armed his teamsters and personally commanded them, successfully fighting against heavy odds and bringing his trains through without the loss of a wagon.
Error: 1864 Jul 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in action where he fell, shot through the face, at the head of his regiment.
Error: 1865 Apr 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Sep 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Jan 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Santiago de Cuba during the assault on Fort Fisher on 15 January 1865.
Error: 1864 Jun 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Removed, under a hot fire, a wounded member of his command to a place of safety.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Took command of his company, all the officers having been killed or wounded, and gallantly led it.
Volunteered to go within the enemy's lines and at the head of a party of 8 destroyed a signal station, thereby greatly aiding in the operations against Port Hudson that immediately followed.

Error: 1864 Dec 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. and Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Obtained permission from the corps commander to advance upon the enemy's position with the 4th U.S. Cavalry, of which he was a lieutenant; led an attack upon a battery, dispersed the enemy, and captured the guns. At Selma, Ala., charged, at the head of his regiment, into the second and last line of the enemy's works.
Error: 1865 Apr 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1862 Dec 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantly responded to a call for volunteers to man a battery, serving with great heroism until the termination of the engagement.
Error: 1864 May 18 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Brought his guidon off in safety under a heavy fire of musketry after he had lost it by his horse becoming furious from the bursting of a shell.
Error: 1864 Apr 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily led a successful assault on a fortified position.
Error: 1864 May 12 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily assisted in working the guns of a battery, all the members of which had been killed or wounded.
Error: 1864 Jun 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Shot a Confederate color bearer, rushed forward and seized his colors, and although exposed to heavy fire, regained the lines in safety.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Took a guidon from the hands of the bearer, mortally wounded, and advanced with it nearer to the battery than any other man.
Error: 1861 November 7 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Although severely wounded in the encounter, he displayed extraordinary courage under the most painful and trying circumstances.
Error: 1863 Nov 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Though severely wounded, was first of his regiment on the summit of the ridge, planted his colors inside the enemy's works, and did not leave the field until after he had been wounded 5 times.
Error: 1863 Jul 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Passed through a murderous fire of grape and canister in delivering orders and re-formed the crowded lines.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Error: 1861 Jul This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1864 May This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Particularly distinguished services as an artillery officer.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Nov 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

After several unsuccessful efforts to recover 3 pieces of abandoned artillery, this officer gallantly led a small force fully 100 yards in advance of the Union lines and brought in the guns, preventing their capture.
Error: 1862 Apr This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Second person to receive Medal of Honor
Error: 1865 Apr 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

With one companion, voluntarily advanced in a reconnaissance beyond the skirmishers, where he was exposed to imminent peril; also, in the same battle, rode to the front with the commanding general to encourage wavering troops to resume the advance, which they did successfully.

Error: 1864 December 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1865 January 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Served on board the U.S.S. Pontoosuc during the capture of Fort Fisher and Wilmington, 24 December 1864, to 22 January 1865. Carrying out his duties faithfully during this period, Betham was recommended for gallantry and skill and for his cool courage while under the fire of the enemy throughout these various actions.
Error: 1865 Apr 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
With a force of but 75 men, while on a scouting expedition, by a judicious disposition of his men, surprised and captured an entire battalion of the enemy's cavalry.
Error: 1862 Sep 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
After his command had been forced to fall back, remained alone on the line of battle, caring for his wounded comrades and carrying one of them to a place of safety.
Error: 1864 December 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Bibber served on board the U.S.S. Agawam, as one of a volunteer crew of a powder boat which was exploded near Fort Fisher 23 December 1864.
Error: 1865 Mar 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 June 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Kearsarge when she destroyed the Alabama off Cherbourg, France, 19 June 1864.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party.
Error: 1864 Feb 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Voluntarily risked his life by taking a horse, under heavy fire, beyond the line of battle for the rescue of his captain, whose horse had been killed in a charge and who was surrounded by the enemy's skirmishers.
Error: 1865 Jan 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Despite heavy return fire by the enemy and the explosion of the 100-pounder Parrott rifle which killed 8 men and wounded 12 more, Sgt. Binder, as captain of a gun, performed his duties with skill and courage during the first 2days of battle.
Error: 1864 May 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Rallied and led into action a portion of the troops who had given way under fierce assaults by the enemy.
Error: 1865 Apr 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 May 12 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1862 Dec 7 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Brother of William P. Black, one of 5 pairs of brothers to be awarded the Medal of Honor.
Error: 1862 Mar 7 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Brother of John C. Black, one of 5 pairs of brothers to be awarded the Medal of Honor.
Error: 1865 Apr 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
At a critical stage of the battle, without orders, led a successful advance upon the enemy.
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Removed severely wounded officers and soldiers from the field while under a heavy fire from the enemy, exposing himself beyond the call of duty, thus furnishing an example of most distinguished gallantry.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Brooklyn during successful attacks against Fort Morgan, rebel gunboats and the ram Tennessee in Mobile Bay, on 5 August 1864.

Error: 1864 December 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1865 January 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Pontoosuc during the capture of Fort Fisher and Wilmington, 24 December 1864 to 22 January 1865.
Error: 1863 Dec 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Escaped slave. First African-American Medal of Honor recipient.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party.
Error: 1865 Apr 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 Sep 28 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

While in command of the provost guard in the village, he saw the Union lines returning before the attack of a greatly superior force of the enemy, mustered his guard, and, without orders, joined in the defense and charged the enemy without support. He received three saber wounds, his horse was shot, and he was taken prisoner.
Error: 1862 Dec 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

This officer, to encourage his regimen; which had never before been in action, and which had been ordered to lie down to protect itself from the enemy's fire, arose to his feet, advanced in front of the line, and himself fired several shots at the enemy at short range, being fully exposed to their fire at the time
Error: 1862 Sep 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
With a single orderly, captured an armed picket of 8 men and marched them in prisoners.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Planted first national colors on the fortifications.
Error: 1864 Oct 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily led a charge across a narrow bridge over the creek against the lines of the enemy.
Error: 1865 Mar 31 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

While acting as aide to General Custer, took a flag from the hands of color bearer, rode in front of a line that was being driven back and, under a heavy fire, rallied the men, re-formed the line, and repulsed the charge.
Error: 1863 May 27 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served as quartermaster on board the U.S.S. Cincinnati during the attack on the Vicksburg batteries and at the time of her sinking, 27 May 1863.
Error: 1864 June 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Served on board the U.S.S. Kearsarge when she destroyed the Alabama off Cherbourg, France, 19 June 1864. Carrying out his duties courageously, Bond exhibited marked coolness and good conduct and was highly recommended for his gallantry under fire by his divisional officer.
Error: 1865 Apr 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
As 1 of the first of Devin's Division to enter the works, he fought in a hand-to-hand struggle with a Confederate to capture his flag by superior physical strength.
Error: 1864 Oct 27 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Checked the rout and rallied the troops of his command in the face of a terrible fire of musketry; was severely wounded.

Error: 1862 May 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. and Error: 1863 May 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1861 Aug 10 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Voluntarily left the line of battle, and, exposing himself to imminent danger from a heavy fire of the enemy, assisted in capturing a riderless horse at large between the lines and hitching him to a disabled gun, saved the gun from capture.
Error: 1864 Jun 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Rescued his lieutenant, who was lying between the lines mortally wounded; this under a heavy fire of the enemy.

Error: 1862 Dec 31 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1863 Jan 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1862 April 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

During this action at extremely close range while his ship was under furious fire and was twice rammed by the rebel ship Morgan, Bourne remained steadfast at his gun and was instrumental in inflicting damage on the enemy until the Varuna, badly damaged and forced to beach, was finally sunk.
Error: 1865 Mar 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Brought off from the picket line, under heavy fire, a comrade who had been shot through both legs.
Error: 1864 Sep 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Gallantry in the charge of the "volunteer storming party"

Error: 1865 January 13 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1865 January 15 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Ticonderoga during attacks on Fort Fisher 13 to 15 January 1865.
Error: 1864 May 14 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of flag of the 38th Alabama Infantry (C.S.A.).
Error: 1863 Nov 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Led his regiment in the face of a severe fire of the enemy; was severely wounded.
Error: 1862 April 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Varuna in one of the most responsible positions, during the attacks on Forts Jackson and St. Philip, and while in action against the rebel ship Morgan, 24 April 1862.

Error: 1863 January 10 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1863 January 11 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Carrying out his duties through the thick of battle and acting as captain of a 9-inch gun, Bradley consistently showed, "Attention to duty, bravery, and coolness in action against the enemy."
Error: 1863 May 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Volunteered in response to a call and alone, in the face of a heavy fire of musketry and canister, went and procured ammunition for the use of his comrades.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Nov 16 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
While color bearer of his regiment, having been twice wounded and the sight of one eye destroyed, still held to the colors until ordered to the rear by his regimental commander.
Error: 1863 May 2 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Volunteered on a dangerous service and brought in valuable information.
Error: 1865 Apr 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of battle flag of 46th North Carolina (C.S.A.).
Error: 1865 Apr 8 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Served on board the U.S.S. Richmond in the action at Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864, where he was recommended for coolness and good conduct as a gun captain during that engagement which resulted in the capture of the rebel ram Tennessee and in the destruction of Fort Morgan. Brazell served gallantly throughout the actions with Forts Jackson and St. Philip, the Chalmettes, batteries below Vicksburg, and was present at the surrender of New Orleans while on board the U.S.S. Brooklyn.
Error: 1862 October 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Error: 1862 April 24 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1862 April 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

On board the U.S.S. Mississippi during attacks on Forts Jackson and St. Philip and during the taking of New Orleans, 24–25 April 1862. Taking part in the actions which resulted in the damaging of the Mississippi and several casualties on it, Brennan showed skill and courage throughout the entire engagements which resulted in the taking of St. Philip and Jackson and in the surrender of New Orleans.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Capture of engineer flag, Army of Northern Virginia.
Error: 1862 Aug 23 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily, and at great personal risk, picked up an unexploded shell and threw it away, thus doubtless saving the life of a comrade whose arm had been taken off by the same shell.
Error: 1865 Apr 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1865 Apr 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Charged the enemy and assisted Sgt. Norton in capturing a fieldpiece and 2 prisoners.
Error: 1863 March 14 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Mississippi during her abandonment and firing in the engagement at Port Hudson, 14 March 1863

Error: 1862 Jun 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. and Error: 1862 Jul 1 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Continued to fight after being severely wounded.
Error: 1864 Sep 29 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Took command of his company, all the officers having been killed or wounded, and gallantly led it.
Error: 1864 Jun 17 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Rescued a wounded comrade who lay exposed to the enemy's fire, receiving a severe wound in the effort.
Error: 1863 Nov 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

To encourage his men whom he had ordered to lie down while under severe fire, and who were partially protected by slight earthworks, himself refused to lie down, but walked along the top of the works until he fell severely wounded.
Error: 1864 Aug 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Error: 1863 May 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input. – Error: 1863 May 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Severely wounded while carrying the colors, he continued at his post, under fire, until ordered to the rear.
Error: 1864 May 6 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Voluntarily and under a heavy fire from the enemy, 3 times crossed the field of battle with a load of ammunition in a blanket on his back, thus supplying the Federal forces, whose ammunition had nearly all been expended, and enabling them to hold their position until reinforcement arrived, when the enemy were driven from their position.
Error: 1863 May 4 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Served on board the U.S.S. Albatross during action against Fort DeRussy in the Red River Area on 4 May 1863.
Error: 1864 Oct 27 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
With 100 selected volunteers, assaulted and captured the works of the enemy, together with a number of officers and men.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Brooklyn during action against rebel forts and gunboats and with the ram Tennessee in Mobile Bay, 5 August 1864.
Error: 1863 May 19 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Voluntarily carried a verbal message from Col. A. C. Parry to Gen. Hugh Ewing through a terrific fire and in plain view of the enemy.
Error: 1864 Nov 30 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1863 Jul 3 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
Error: 1864 August 5 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.
On board the U.S.S. Richmond in action at Mobile Bay on 5 August 1864.
Error: 1863 Nov 25 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Upon reaching the ridge through concentrated fire, he approached the color bearer of the 9th Mississippi Infantry (C.S.A.), demanded his surrender with threatening gesture and took him prisoner with his regimental flag.
Error: 1863 May 22 This is not an acceptable date format. Please check the spelling, check the numbers and/or read the documentation at template for correct date input.

Despite the death of his captain at his side during the assault he continued carrying his log to the defense ditch. While he was laying his log in place he was shot down and thrown into the water. Unmindful of his own wound he, despite the intense fire, dragged 5 of his comrades from the ditch, wherein they lay wounded, to a place of safety.

Served as coxswain on board the U.S.S. Benton during the attack on Great Gulf Bay, 2 May 1863, and Vicksburg, 22 May 1863.
